articles.title: CALENDAR OF EVENTS
articles.summary: This calendar outlines various club activities for July and August, including a club picnic and officer installation on July 9 at Ed Levin Park, and two observing sessions: one at Sanborn Canyon Park on July 16 and another on July 2. The usual July general meeting is canceled in favor of the picnic, but a lecture on Black Holes is scheduled for August 5 at Olinder Center.

articles.title: BOARD ELECTIONS
articles.summary: At the June 3rd general meeting of the SJAA, five new members were elected to the association's board of directors: Jack Zeiders, Jim Van Nuland, John Gleason, Cathy Pinnero, and Bob Fingerhut. Additionally, four existing board members — Dr. Gregory, Allan Meyer, Gerry Rattley, and John Rhodes — will continue their service for another year.

articles.title: MEMBERSHIP RENEWALS
articles.summary: Members are urged to renew their memberships for $15 (regular) or $10 (junior, under 18) by submitting their yellow Sky and Telescope renewal cards and fee to Treasurer John Rhodes. This month is the final opportunity to renew without risking a lapse in receiving Sky and Telescope magazine and the monthly bulletin.

articles.title: SJAA
articles.summary: The SJAA is actively seeking old club records, including constitutional revisions and past bulletins, to compile a club history book. A recent Public Education and Astronomy Outreach (P.E.A.O.) event was unfortunately clouded out, though a potential new observing site at Lexington School was noted. Simultaneously, several SJAA members across different locations witnessed a spectacular blue-white fireball on June 18th, which briefly illuminated the sky like daylight and left a visible trail for minutes, estimated to be brighter than a full moon.

articles.title: A D S  I N F I N I T U M
articles.summary: This document, titled "ADS INFINITUM," contains two classified advertisements. One ad is a 'wanted' request for a 6 or 8-inch telescope for a potential new member, considering various mount types. The second ad lists several 1¼" eyepieces (K, 18mm; K, 12mm; Or. 9mm; Or. 6mm) for sale at $12 each, with contact information provided for both listings.
